p: In the teens' networks, Mandy Sanghera (A1), the American Psychological Association (O1), and the Ottawa Public Health (I2) play the central role in group 1, group 2, and group 4, respectively. People belong to small groups, and rarely communicate with others across the groups. All key players have an independent group except for the Junior Achievement (O7) and CNBC (N2; group 12) and NAGC (O9) and C. Elizabeth Dougherty (O10; group 17).
